attributes.action: Include all armed services veterans on the 2021 census
attributes.background: Our armed services form a historical and vital part of our community. Although the service records are there we just do not know how many veterans are still with us or where. This would help the Government to plan and possibly allocate resources to areas with a high veteran population.
attributes.additional_details: By including veterans into the census this would bring to the veterans a sense that they are really valued by us all.

attributes.action: Rename the RRS Sir David Attenborough to RRS Boaty McBoatface
attributes.background: Britain is known worldwide for both it's excellent scientific research and sense of humour. NERC should accept the choice of RRS Boaty McBoatface (124,109 votes), rather than for RRS Sir David Attenborough (10,284 votes) and respect the true democratic result and excellent British wit.

attributes.action: Limit paying out Child Benefit to the first two children only.
attributes.background:
As the law stands, Child Benefit can be paid out to people who have children. This may or may not be the parents.
The payment for the first child is currently £20.70
For each additional child, it is £13.70 per child.
We believe that Child Benefit should be limited to the first two children only.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that benefits are in the gift of the Government.
As the law currently stands, Child Benefit is paid at the rate of £20.70 for the first child and £13.70 for each additional child.
We believe that this needs to change and that the Government should legislate to limit the payout of Child Benefit to the first two children only.
This would reduce the benefits bill and the burden on the taxpayers.
People who wish to have more than two children should not expect the state to pay for them.

attributes.action: Help Britain's homeless find shelter instead of moving them on all the time.
attributes.background: There are far too many homeless people on the streets of Britain, many of them have had unfortunate events which lead up to them finding themselves on the streets. They should be given help and assistance in finding accommodation instead of being moved on and looked down on. Please sign and help.
attributes.additional_details: Our local council keep moving the local homeless guys on, instead of spending money doing this why can't the fund a hostel or something locally for these guys to go to.

attributes.action: Make primary/high schools stagger half terms making family holidays affordable
attributes.background: I believe that family holidays should be a given right for every child, childhood memories that are achievable for every family regardless of age, race or social status. If schools were to stagger the half term holidays this would give families flexibility to enable them to book affordable holidays
attributes.additional_details: I come from a modest hard working family who gave me and my sister a holiday every year usually with extended family. These are precious memories and are experiences that have contributed towards making me the hard working single mother I am today. I work hard and save to take my children to see different places in the world, my son is 9yrs old he is now keen to go on to study geography. His dream is to visit every continent before he is 21. I would like to help him with this dream but it is difficult without getting myself into debt, incurring fines and/or the stigma that is forced upon parents like me because of the current regulations.

attributes.action: Train all cyclist's to use the roads safely.
attributes.background: Cyclists are vulnerable road users but don't help themselves. Cyclists should have to take a theory test, cycling test, a type of registration plate, made to wear safety equipment, have insurance and a certificate to say their bike is road worthy!
attributes.additional_details: Cyclists jumping red lights is dangerous, not having correctly working brakes, dangerous and lack of understanding also dangerous, I could go on and on. The number of cyclists is increasing, so is the rate of accidents. Too many ride at night with no lights, if cars did that, we'd get pulled in.... Make the roads safer and fairer for all road users. What person in their right mind would go down the left side of a lorry that's turning left? Training would help and create jobs!

attributes.action: Allow tax-paying UK residents to vote in general elections and referendums
attributes.background:
Excluding tax paying immigrants from the voting population makes the vote less representative of the will of the UK because it silences a very important part of the engine of the country.
Let's make sure going forward all the people who love and work hard for this country have a say in its future.

attributes.action: Include tattoo, body piercings & hair colour in the anti-discrimination act.
attributes.background: In an age that wants us to be accepting of unconventional values, it should be law for employers to refuse you an interview or a job for creative physical expression.
attributes.additional_details: Tattoos, body piercings and diverse hair colours are an act of freedom and self expression in a linear society that wants us to conform to physical norm. They do not affect the level of service we provide to our work sectors and every individual should be able to physically express themselves however they want no matter what job they do. It should be law as part of the anti-discrimination act to be accepting towards those with any tattoos on the body, any hair colour and any piercings.

attributes.action: Offer financial support for students who have had to defer for medical reasons.
attributes.background: If a full time university student has to defer the course due to medical reasons, there are no provisions in place to prevent them from becoming homeless or to access financial support. Many students defer each year and are forced to give up their education in order to claim state benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
Department for Work and Pensions regulations do not consider deferred students, even if they are signed off sick by their GP. 

Housing benefit do not consider deferred students even if they have dependent children. 

Student Finance England can only provide up to 60 days worth of funding if you provide adequate evidence for the reason why you've had to defer. 

Universities have grants for those in hardship but have a yearly allowance. You cannot go over this limit under any circumstances.

attributes.action: Provide 15 hours free childcare for ages between 1year and 3 years old
attributes.background: 30 hours free childcare is provided for children from the ages of 3 but there is nothing in place between the ages of 1 and 3 years of age, limiting mothers returning to work and causing families to struggle with childcare costs.
attributes.additional_details: The government have increased childcare hours to 30 hours free after the age of 3. But there is still nothing in place for children aged between 1 year old and 3 years old. Nurseries are ridiculously expensive and women have a fight between returning to work and having their wages spent on childcare and having nothing left after or not returning to work and still struggling to get by with no income. It's just as hard on joint income families as it is on single parents. Providing 15 hours free childcare between these ages allows mothers to return to work after maternity without the worry of extortionate childcare costs but also provides essential and vital development for children of these ages.

attributes.action: Ban bonfires in residential areas between the hours of 600 and 1900 on weekdays
attributes.background: So many peoples lives are blighted by the indiscriminate starting of bonfires in residential areas

attributes.action: Remove unnecessary traffic lights from roundabouts on the A27
attributes.background: I would like the Government to remove the traffic lights from the crossbush junction,the offington roundabout and the lewis roundabout , the lights are unnecessary as power outages with the lights has proven the traffic flows better without and reduces congestion and travel times.
attributes.additional_details: Travel times along the a27 would be greatly reduced if the lights were removed and the roundabouts restored to be free flowing and uncontrolled, whenever the Traffic lights are disabled, traffic flow is greatly increased and fuel economy, travel times etc improve also.  It shouldn't take over half an hour to drive from one side of worthing to the other along a major road such as the A27, and often traffic on a dual carriageway is stationary for 2 miles approaching the crossbush traffic lights.

attributes.action: The new British Ajax armoured fighting vehicles ALL to be built in the UK.
attributes.background: In a time when British industry, particularly the steel industry, is in crisis, it is abhorrent to patriotic British people that equipment intended for use by our service personnel is being built outside of our country and using materials that have not been supplied from our country

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that all 18650 batteries come with care and safety  leaflets
attributes.background:
Due to the recent influx and high demand of more advanced, and powerful  electronic  cigarettes, 18650 batteries have become more in use to power these devices. 
I feel that people aren't either receiving the right safety guidance, or buying these online, and not knowing how dangerous they can be.
attributes.additional_details:
I want it to be compulsory that all 18650 batteries either bought, or shipped to the UK, come with a leaflet explaining the proper care and handling of these batteries. Giving a stronger and a better understanding of how dangerous they can be. Not just a simple 'warning' and a picture or two on the wraps of these batteries.
Some larger companies do not even have a warning sign on the batteries, and it is then left to vendors, or hope people have done their researched.

attributes.action: Make basic healthcare part of the curriculum in high schools.
attributes.background:
High school students across the UK should be receiving training for looking after their health.
Knowledge could save lives.
Imagine a future for our NHS with less strain on the system because people are trained to manage basic issues like fevers, understanding dosages, minor cuts and sickness.
attributes.additional_details:
A regular class on the curriculum could cover a lot of information, making a large difference. It could prevent patients showing up in A&E for a broken nail or hair extensions that got stuck (these are examples of actual cases). 
All of this could be prevented in future because they will have been educated to know how to deal with illness and minor injuries and when to see a doctor.
We can't predict the fate of the NHS, but we can prepare our children and teach them to use the NHS respectfully.

attributes.action: Make self-defence classes mandatory for one school term for students aged 11-14.
attributes.background: This idea started after a female friend and I spoke about feeling unsafe in some areas, and her (and others) ignorance when it came to violent confrontations. We should educate young people to at least know the basics of self defence to prevent assault (sexual/violent) and petty crime.
attributes.additional_details: As of 2015, figures from the CSEW showed (for the offences it covers) an estimated 6.8 million criminal incidents. Offences involving knives and sharp instruments increased by 2% in the year ending March 2015. More significant changes at offence level include an increase in assaults (up 13%, from 11,911 to 13,488). Sexual offences recorded by the police rose by 37% with the numbers of rapes (29,265) and other sexual offences (58,954) being at the highest level since 2002.

attributes.action: Require a valid un-tampered VIN and V5C to race a banger/stock car
attributes.background: With the recent spate of stolen Ford Cortinas in the last month, and a large 'All Cortina' banger racing meet planned for June of 2016, questions have been raised about the possibility of these stolen cars ending up on the track. We'd like to see raced cars requiring valid VIN and V5C to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Of course the majority of banger drivers would never go near a stolen car, but the fact exists that cars do get stolen for this purpose. I'd like to see a law passed requiring all banger / stock car events requiring cars to have a valid and un-tampered VIN, and a V5C as proof the car has not been stolen. This won't affect the majority of banger drivers who are genuine, but will stop people's cars from being stolen after years of blood sweat and tears have gone into them.

attributes.action: Give all 16 and 17 year olds the vote in referenda that affect their future
attributes.background: In the June 2016 referendum on whether to remain in the UK, 16 and 17 year old citizens have been denied a say on this important question, yet will endure its consequences for the next 60 to 70 years. Their fate has been decided by older people who have less at stake. This is morally wrong.

attributes.action: Regulate political campaign material and communications
attributes.background:
In the most recent UK referendum on membership of the EU, campaign materials & messages on both sides contained gross mistruths, irregularities and exaggeration.

Citizens must be able to rely on campaign messages which are clear, factual and informative so that we can submit fully informed votes
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral Commission regulates a lot of the process around elections & voting, but there is currently no regulation from any body on political campaign materials and messages. I propose that the EC's remit is extended to regulate this as well. This would enable the voting public to execute their democratic right in a fully informed way. As to ask people to make an important choice on anything other than independently-verified facts & information runs the risk of destabilising our democracy.

attributes.action: Do not trigger Article 50 until second EU referendum.
attributes.background: The current divide following 1st EU referendum means that the population is not represented at all, and the campaign was based on misleading information.

attributes.action: Provides refuge in the UK for our armed forces interpreters in all war zones
attributes.background: I served for 30 years in the RAF, I completed my service for my country in 2005. To read that the country I served for, is hanging out to dry, even signing the death warrant of those brave local people, and their families who assisted our personnel in recent war zones deeply upsets me.
attributes.additional_details:
Trade                    Aircraft Avionics
Rank                     Chief Technician
Last Posting         RAF Cosford

attributes.action: Block Scotland spending another £14M of British money on another referendum.
attributes.background: The last referendum cost the British taxpayer £14M. If we come out of the EU, they are citing doing this again. They've already said no once, we cant waste another £14M on this again.

attributes.action: Call for a new General Election.
attributes.background: In light of the Conservative governments failure to reduce the national debt, the county feels they are not competent enough to lead our nation. Local councils are falling apart,  the NHS is in crisis,  the most vulnerable are being penalised while making financial gains to the top 1%!
attributes.additional_details:
According to the latest official figures, public debt has increased by £555 billion since 2010.

Public debt now stands at 89.4% of our national income (GDP), up from 78.4% when then the Tories came to power in 2010.

Every budget has seen a U turn and the house of Lords have time and time again blocked unfair measures being introduced.  Once the current Governnent get a result they don't like then they bully through the measures anyway. 

The nation's trust in this government has vanished.

attributes.action: Stop the Housing and Planning Bill change to social housing access for under 35s
attributes.background: Hidden in the Housing and Planning Bill is the proposal that benefit for social housing is changed so that those who are single aged under 35 will not be able to access an affordable social tenancy, they will be expected to share, including if they are vulnerable and/or in work or training.
attributes.additional_details: The Bill is likely to have a significant impact on single people under 35 since currently they are only eligible for the shared accommodation rate in the private sector. This will make difficult the letting of one bedroom social tenancies to single people under 35 who may be reliant on some form of housing benefit (including many of those in work). This is age discrimination and particularly unfair for vulnerable young people who cannot share accommodation due to mental health; autism, etc.

attributes.action: Create an annual "dark sky" night
attributes.background: In the UK, few people get to see the true beauty of the night sky. I propose that, on a night when it is safe to do so, the country should turn off as many street lights at midnight as possible in an effort to eliminate "light pollution"
attributes.additional_details: I suggest that a Sunday night before a bank holiday would be the best occasion to do this. In order to minimise the chances of Moonlight spoiling the effect (or of cloud), this could be done on Easter Monday or May Day (or possibly both), with a degree of "fluidity" as to which is chosen, dependent on the position of the Moon that year.

attributes.action: Make Companies not regulated by the Consumer Credit Act send Default notices
attributes.background: Companies that are not regulated by the consumer Credit Act are able to report 'defaults' to credit reference agencies without any prior notice to the customer. 'defaults' remain on a credit file for 6 years often without the customer knowing, severely damaging ability to obtain credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies that are regulated by consumer Credit Act are required to send a Default Notice, giving the customer the opportunity to resolve the problem before sharing Default data with credit reference agencies. 

Companies not regulated by the consumer Credit Act such as mobile phone providers, internet providers are not required to send default notices before reporting defaults to credit reference agencies.

attributes.action: Impose trade sanctions on China until they end the Yulin Dog Meat Festival.
attributes.background: 10,000 dogs and cats are killed every year as part of a festival in Yulin, China. The dogs, some of which are stolen from families, are abused and killed in the most horrific ways. Dogs are sentient beings which means they experience emotions like happiness, fear and pain, just like humans do.
attributes.additional_details: The objective of this campaign is based on the old adage of 'money talks' - we need our government to step up and impose trade sanctions until China deals with this barbaric and inhumane festival once and for all.

attributes.action: Ensure 100% broadband coverage for everyone in the UK.
attributes.background: Access to broadband is now a key utility, & in business relied upon as much as water, light and heat. 95% of the UK is covered by some form of broadband connection is fine; denying the remaining 5% - businesses and consumers - (mainly rural areas) is a disgrace; & is creating a two speed country.
attributes.additional_details: Approx. a million businesses & homes — mainly rural areas — will not be receiving superfast broadband by close of 2016, and for those who have poor broadband service, its ‘Universal Service Obligation’ will require homes and businesses in the 5 per cent of areas that don’t yet have fast broadband to request the service & pay for it themselves. It could take until 2020 for the connection to arrive. This petition is to fix this unjust & ensure the Government reverts to their promise 100% service.

attributes.action: Allow U.K. expatriates to vote in the E.U. referendum
attributes.background:
Current law prevents expatriates who have been 'ordinarily non resident' - as defined by HMRC - from voting in any U.K. election.
This inspite of the fact that a vast majority are expatriates due to employment, family or health reasons. They are also required to submit U.K. tax returns.
attributes.additional_details: Incarcerated criminals are currently denied the vote in the U.K. Are expats classed as criminals?

attributes.action: Ban all Non Biodegradable packaging from being used
attributes.background:
Not only does the burning of fossil fuels pollute the air we breath, and slowly raise the sea levels adding more and more fresh water slowly desalinated them.
Likewise the use of plastics in packaging is another huge risk to the oceans as it poisons or strangles the marine life.
attributes.additional_details:
widely 'over' used to replace glass or other natural biodegradables.
Thousands of tonnes get into our oceans every year, which poisons any marine life around them.
While in the sea it simply gets broken into smaller chunks, now easily consumable by all marine life
We then eat these animals unwittingly POISONING ourselves.
Everyone hates trying to tear or cut through these types of packing anyway, so let's get rid of them!
We need to be more careful with our planet or we will lose it!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to pull out of selling a property once the sale had been agreed.
attributes.background: My wife and I are trying to buy our  first home. We have agreed to buy three different properties and the sellers ended up backing out on all three occasions. This is extremely upsetting and frustrating. This is not legal in other countries, so why should it be here? Home buyers should be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Almost everyone we know who had bought a home had this happen at least once. This is a huge problem and unfair for those trying to buy a home. 

The seller can pull out of the sale at any time until contracts have been exchanged. The buyer can have spent lots of money before this and up losing hundreds, if not thousands,  of pounds. 

In Scotland, once a sale has been agreed, then the sellers must go ahead. 

The law on this country should be changed to save home buyers from this heartache.

attributes.action: Enforce the Disability Discrimination Act at government and local authorities
attributes.background: The Select Committee on Equality and Disability's report shows the government, and local authorities, are not enforcing the DDA.  We call on the government to enforce the Act, and tell local authorities they must enforce it, and produce an annual report to parliament on the steps they have taken.
attributes.additional_details:
The Select Committee on the Equality Act 2010 and Disability has produced a report: The Equality Act 2010: the impact on disabled people see http://bit.ly/DDAreport which points to serious problems with enforcement of the DDA including:
planning applications not being required to meet it,
Red tape unit ignoring needs of people with disabilities
Transport being inaccessible, and no enforcement of DDA
etc

attributes.action: Review Government plans to force all maintained schools to become academies.
attributes.background: In light of concerns expressed by Ofsted Chief Inspector, Sir Michael Wilshaw and chairman of the Local Government Association’s children and young people board, Councillor Roy Perry, is it right to push through this agenda so hastily?
attributes.additional_details:
In a recent Guardian article, Councillor Perry is quoted as saying that 82% of council-maintained schools are rated as good or outstanding by Ofsted and that 15% of the largest academy chains perform above the national average in terms of pupil progress, compared with 44% of council-run schools.

Guardian article: http://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/mar/15/every-english-school-to-become-an-academy-ministers-to-announce

Sir Michael Wilshaw expresses concerns about academy results and finances: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-35775458

attributes.action: Debate MPs disrespect for the Speaker & leader of the opposition.
attributes.background: John Bercow's failure to call the House to order, during Government bench MP disorder during Jeremy Corbyn's contributions, calls into question MPs & Speaker's respect for behavioural responsibilities of MPs, evidenced in the video link: https://www.facebook.com/PigGateuk/videos/516561248515067/
attributes.additional_details:
The following links to media coverage, evidence the significant journalistic & public concern over MP behaviour & failed cognisance of acceptable conduct within the House, which compromise the Speaker's management of MPs who openly display disrespect within the House & in particular to the leader of the opposition & opposition MPs.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newsvideo/uk-politics-video/8636865/Order-How-Speaker-of-the-House-of-Commons-John-Bercow-fails-to-keep-control-of-the-children.html

attributes.action: Lower Abortion Stage from 24 Weeks to 12 Weeks, Due to babies being able to live
attributes.background: Lower the abortion stage from 24 weeks to under 16 wèeks as babies are born at 24 weeks and survived.

attributes.action: Make the production and sale of marijuana legal in UK
attributes.background: Prohibition on marijuana in the UK has gone on for too long. For 88 years innocent civilians have had to break the law if they wanted to partake in a statistically less harmful substance than cigarettes or alcohol which kill over 100,000 people yearly. England has a chance to get ahead of the curve.
attributes.additional_details: Legal Marijuana sale/use is on the cusp of becoming a reality in the US. This petition may not lead to decriminalisation of marijuana, but we all know it's going to happen within the next 5 - 10 years. So why imprison these innocent people for a longer period of time, just decriminalise it now! Crime will go down statistically. And the amount of revenue the government would make on tax is such an untapped market just waiting for the right structure to be put in place. Make it happen. 2016 Legal

attributes.action: Raise awareness in the NHS of Superior Mesenteric Artery Syndrome
attributes.background: Hi I'm Isla Evans, 32 years old and I live in the North East of Scotland with my husband and 2 young children. I was diagnosed with Smas December 2015 after suffering for over 20 years with symptoms GP continually put down to Anxiety or eating disorder. Smas is a rare disease with a mortality of 1.3
attributes.additional_details:
Smas is very rare with only 400 known cases world wide. I am the second in Scotland to be diagnosed. 
I want this rare disease to be recognised and for more awareness to be made. More knowledge for gps and treatment options for known sufferers. As it stands there's no surgeon willing to take my case on in the uk as it is so complex and they say surgery poses more risk than benefit to my life. Had I been diagnosed sooner I wouldn't have got so I'll. Knowledge and awareness is key.

attributes.action: Review and reconsider the social work profession and forthcoming reforms.
attributes.background: The Government has announced a swathe of reforms for the Social work profession that seems to focus on accreditation and more justification processes for practitioners.
attributes.additional_details:
The pressures of front line staff juggling high increasingly complex caseloads in a climate of high poverty, low investment and social challenge has been unaddressed again.the high demand created by endless administration and paperwork ignored, the hours of expected unpaid overtime and burnout unconsidered. 
I want this issue re-debated and recognition that the challenges social work faces aren't down to a lack of commitment, qualification or professionalism. Social workers know what needs to change to deliver better outcomes for vulnerable children and adults. Why has the government not asked us?

attributes.action: Subsidise organic fruit and vegetables so that people can afford to live.
attributes.background:
There is ample evidence that shows herbicides and pesticides used in conventional farming cause cancer. 

People have the right to live a healthy life and starting with organic fruit and veg is essential. 

Working class families simply cannot afford to go organic because it is so expensive
attributes.additional_details:
Independent bodies conclude herbicides can cause cancer, only bodies financially backed by industry deny it http://www.nature.com/news/debate-rages-over-herbicide-s-cancer-risk-1.18794

1 in 2 people in the UK will develop cancer (Cancer Research UK). This appauling figure should and can be reduced. And starting with organic healthy eating is the first step in this battle. http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-us/cancer-news/press-release/2015-02-04-1-in-2-people-in-the-uk-will-get-cancer

attributes.action: In a 2nd independence referendum, Scots living outside Scotland will get a vote
attributes.background: The recent referendum on EU membership may now precipitate a 2nd Scottish independence referendum.  If the Scottish Government takes this step, then it is reasonable that Scottish-born people currently living outside of Scotland have a vote in such a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Scottish-born people, whether they are currently living in England or elsewhere, will be affected by the result of such a referendum, as it will have serious and life-changing implications for their future choice of nationality, citizenship and passport etc., both for themselves and for their descendants.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the result of referendums in the UK legally binding.
attributes.background: Referendums held in the UK are not currently legally enforceable and parliament is under no duty to enact their results. MPs are elecred by the will of the people to represent the people, as such they must comply democratically with the demands of the people.
attributes.additional_details: From time to time UK Governments hold referendums. Regardless of the outcome, the government is under no legal obligation to accept the outcome. This is entirely undemocratic and must change.

attributes.action: Make telesales cold calling and door to door cold calling illegal.
attributes.background: I have had to deal with so many cold callers. They range from the apologetic and helpful to the rude and arogant. Cold callers have no idea who they are calling. Some are able to just say 'no' and hang up or shut the door but others aren't and are left vulnerable to scams and unnecessary purchases.
attributes.additional_details: If you are cold calling then you have no idea who you are speaking to or their situation. You have no idea of their mental health or financial status. Being involved with caring for my Mum who has Alzheimers and having dealt with many of these calls, I have seen and experienced the stress and upset cold calling can cause. I am sure I am not alone in this experience. Mum is lucky I am there to do this, many others won't be that lucky which is why the Goverment need to make cold calling illegal.

attributes.action: Legalize the testing of cannabis oil in treatment for cancer patients and others
attributes.background: Science has proven and there are many case study's you can read where cannabis oil has cured cancer victims and various other diseases. Start doing legalized studies immediately and defeat the greed that is pharmaceutical companies making families suffer this terrible disease any longer.

attributes.action: Ban the labelling of any container under 35L a "fish tank" or "aquarium"
attributes.background:
Keeping fish in such small aquariums amounts to animal cruelty, it would be like keeping a cat in a hamster cage!

Due to years of goldfish bowls common belief leads people to use such small tanks, the only way to stop this is to ban the labelling of small tank "fish tanks"

attributes.action: Stop funding the search for Madeleine McCann.
attributes.background: The funds being spent on finding her could be spent on other things helping more people.
attributes.additional_details: The McCanns left her unattended and the taxpayer is now paying the price in finding her. Other parents with missing children have thousands spent on trying to find them not millions. This money could be used to help ex servicemen who are homeless or injured or to any of the other deserving charities in the UK that help children.

attributes.action: Allow at least 20,000 unaccompanied Syrian children into the UK in 2016.
attributes.background: As a father of three young children, who just so happen to have been born in a stable country, I feel passionately that we should help these very vulnerable children from Syria.

attributes.action: Foreigners in a relationship with a UK citizen have a right to live in the UK
attributes.background: We believe that a foreigner in a relationship with a UK citizen, if they have a clean criminal record and have lived with their UK partner for 2 years, should have automatic right to reside with their partner in the UK, regardless of how much they earn.

attributes.action: Re-introduce summer schools funding for disadvantaged pupils.
attributes.background: Summer schools funding was introduced as a coalition inititave to enable disadvantaged pupils to attend summer school at no cost. This helped lots of young people off the streets and into school over summer. Recently this was scrapped. This funding is necessary for the growth of British youth.
attributes.additional_details: Getting children off the streets and into the classroom during the summer period only serves to strengthen the future of Britain's youth. Please sign this petition to have the summer schools funding for disadvantaged pupils program reinstated. The Conservative party have already taken grants away from the poorer adults in society. Don't let them do something similar to our children. It's not fair.

attributes.action: That April 21st, the Queen's 90th birthday, be made a public holiday
attributes.background: As Her Majesty is the longest reigning monarch in British History we should mark this and her 90th birthday with a public holiday so that the nation can join her in celebrating this milestone.

attributes.action: Introduce Automatic Voter Registration in the UK
attributes.background: In the past few days, people have struggled to register to vote at the 'last minute' - an hour before closing. Every citizen over 18 has the right to do so. We should not be putting an arbitrary barrier in the way and should be making it as easy as possible to register to vote.
attributes.additional_details:
When signing up for a driving licence, we are asked if we would like to join the organ donor register - most 17 year old are asked the question. They could also be provisionally registered to vote at this time with an 'opt out' clause here.
Registration for further licences, e.g. HGVs, could prompt the same option.
Interaction with other government agencies could offer scope for a similar opt out option arrangement - e.g. student loans, pensions, benefits, HMRC
